content:
BEGININPUT
BEGINCONTEXT
url: https://www.biography.com/scientist/albert-einstein
ENDCONTEXT
Albert Einstein, a theoretical physicist who developed the theory of relativity, did not speak until he was four years old and did not read until he was seven. His parents thought he might be intellectually disabled. Despite these early challenges, he went on to win the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921. 

ENDINPUT
BEGININSTRUCTION
At what ages did Albert Einstein start speaking and reading, and did he win a Nobel Prize?

ENDINSTRUCTION

Albert Einstein started speaking at the age of four and reading at the age of seven. Despite initial concerns from his parents about his intellectual abilities, he went on to achieve significant success in his field. Yes, he won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.
